title: Are you supposed to repeat “the” when two “ the” nouns are used conjointly (grammar, English)? - Quora

response.answer_text: The cat and dog left the house. The cat and the dog left the apartment. Hmm, so when they’re leaving a house you need only one “the”, but when they’re leaving an apartment you need both. ← joke If you are thinking that the group left, use one; if you want to emphasize that each left, use both.
